intro: Lophosciadium meoides, commonly known as the mountain nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Lophosciadium meoides is adapted to harsh, arid environments and has a deep root system to access moisture. It is often found in rocky soils and is part of the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades.
